intro: Pouzolzia spinosobracteata, commonly known as the spiny bract pouzolzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Phytolacaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and distinctive spiny bracts. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in its native habitat.
